title: CS Curriculum Redesign
description: Completely redesigned the Computer Science curriculum to emphasize computational thinking, problem-solving, and Christian character development. Created scaffolded projects that build from basic programming concepts to advanced algorithms.
details: Developed a comprehensive curriculum framework that integrates Reformed Christian principles with modern CS education. The curriculum includes 40+ hands-on projects, assessment rubrics, and teacher resources.
impact: Improved student engagement by 60% and pass rates by 25%. Students now see CS as a tool for serving others and solving real-world problems.

title: Math Visualization Tools
description: Created interactive visualizations and simulations for calculus and algebra concepts, making abstract mathematical ideas tangible and engaging for students.
details: Built 25+ interactive tools covering topics from basic functions to advanced calculus. Each tool includes guided exploration activities and real-world applications.
impact: Students showed 40% improvement in conceptual understanding and 30% increase in problem-solving confidence.

title: Classroom Coding Workshops
description: Designed and delivered hands-on coding workshops that improved student engagement and learning outcomes through project-based learning.
details: Created 15+ workshop modules covering web development, game programming, and data analysis. Each workshop includes collaborative projects and peer learning activities.
impact: Workshop participants showed 50% higher retention rates and 35% better performance in subsequent CS courses.

title: Student Portfolio Platform
description: Developed a web-based platform for students to showcase their projects, reflect on their learning journey, and document character development.
details: Built a full-stack application with user authentication, project galleries, reflection journals, and peer review features. Includes teacher dashboard for assessment and feedback.
impact: Enhanced student self-reflection and helped teachers track both academic and character development over time.

title: Algorithm Learning Games
description: Created educational games that teach algorithmic thinking through interactive puzzles and challenges, making complex concepts accessible and fun.
details: Developed 8 different games covering sorting algorithms, pathfinding, and data structures. Each game includes progressive difficulty levels and learning analytics.
impact: Students using the games showed 45% better understanding of algorithmic concepts and 60% higher engagement in algorithm courses.

title: Data Science for Social Good
description: Led student projects analyzing real-world data to address community issues, combining technical skills with service learning.
details: Students analyzed local data on topics like traffic patterns, environmental factors, and community needs. Projects resulted in actionable insights for local organizations.
impact: Students developed both technical skills and a heart for service. Several projects led to actual community improvements and policy recommendations.

title: Teacher Training Program
description: Designed and implemented a comprehensive training program for fellow educators on integrating technology and Christian worldview in STEM education.
details: Created 20+ training modules covering pedagogical approaches, technology integration, and character formation in technical subjects. Includes hands-on workshops and ongoing mentorship.
impact: Trained 15+ teachers who reported improved confidence in teaching technology and better integration of worldview in their classrooms.

title: Accessibility-First Web Development
description: Developed web applications and taught students to build inclusive, accessible websites that serve users with diverse abilities.
details: Created templates and guidelines for accessible web development. Students built websites for local organizations with full accessibility compliance.
impact: Students learned to see technology as a tool for inclusion and service. Several student projects were adopted by local nonprofits.
